items.content_html:
Currently, a class is used to target the nested <kbd> elements. I think this defeats the purpose of nesting.

Instead, I have removed the class and changed the selector to kbd>kbd which is more in keeping with nesting.

Can someone tell me what to do about updating the sample result?

items.content_html:
Summary

Drop 0 from fractionalSecondDigits values spec.
Because it is incorrect with Intl API Spec.

Motivation

Actually web browsers does not implement to allow 0 for fractionalSecondDigits, and throws RangeError when using fractionalSecondDigits: 0.
I confirmed with Chrome v101, Safari v15.4, Firefox v99 and Node.js v16,v17.

Supporting details

fractionalSecondDigits does not allow 0 in ECMAScript® 2021 Internationalization API Specification.
https://402.ecma-international.org/8.0/#sec-datetimeformat-abstracts

Related issues

tc39/ecma402#590

Metadata

  • Adds a new document
  • Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: Drop `0` from fractionalSecondDigits values spec.

items.content_html:
This is the release note for FF101 support of HTMLInputElement.showPicker(), added in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1745005

Related docs work can be tracked in #15407
items.title: FF101 RelNote: HTMLInputElement.showPicker() supported

items.content_html:
FF101 supports HTMLInputElement.showPicker() - added in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1745005

This updates the existing doc to reflect some points that I felt were not clear:

  1. The input types that are supported depends on the browser - it is desirably "all inputs that normally have a picker also work with showpicker" but this is not guaranteed.
  2. Make it clear that this allows you to programmatically trigger an existing picker for an input via user interaction from some other control like a button.
  3. Add the exception for the mutable case.
  4. Add examples for autocomplete and datalist
  5. Add live examples for each of the types to make it much easier to test which are supported on particular platforms.

Other docs work tracked in #15407
items.title: HTMLInputElement.showPicker() doc improvements

items.content_html:
Summary

Remove content about Error.prototype.toSource, Error.prototype.description, and Error.prototype.number (non-standard and obsolete).

Motivation

Remove non-standard obsolete attributes in accordance with BCD guideline "Removal of irrelevant features".

Supporting details

  1. Error.prototype.toSource was removed from Firefox (as shown in BCD and confirmed by testing) and Firefox Android (as tested). Tested with jsconsole.com and the folloqing:
    • 'toString' in Error.prototype returns true
    • 'toSource' in Error.prototype returns false
  2. Error.prototype.description and Error.prototype.number are long gone, do not even show up in IE mode in Edge and IE 11. Error.prototype.description was replaced with standard Error.prototype.message which was released in IE 6 (according to BCD). Error.prototype.number usage can be somewhat replaced by Error.prototype.name which was also released in IE 6 (according to BCD).

Related issues

TBD

Metadata

  • Adds a new document
  • Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: Remove obsolete attributes of Error

items.content_html:
Summary

made "Test your skills!" pages of the Learn/HTML and Learn/CSS modules more consistent:

  • add tags where they where missing / incomplete
  • add missing sidebar in the background and borders skill test
  • adapt introduction sentences
  • adapt note box (under the introduction sentences) - the "However" part.
  • adapt headings to fit the articles title and use numbers instead of written out numbers (i thought this is easier to read and also in the discourse forum easier and clearer to handle)
  • adapt "Assessment or further help" sections to be uniform
  • adapt the code example (interactive editor) sentences and "boxes"

Motivation

to keep things consistent - i have done this "consistency changes" now a few times in prs and it was always appreciated.

i made a few decisions based on how most test your skills pages (including the ones for Learn/JavaScript...) were structured and written (e.g. the boxes below the interactive editros were written most of the time in the "shorter way", but not for the Learn/CSS part)

  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: Make Test your skills pages consistent

The current description of the values min-content, max-content is too opaque. The description of fit-content is somewhat cumbersome, in the specification it is a lot more clear.

Summary

Motivation

Because can confuse devs and they could use this RTCStatsType in production which is not recommended.

items.content_html:
Fixes #15523

I tested the behaviour and checked the spec.

  • If the port is not set, URL.port is set to ''.
  • If the port is set to the default scheme, URL.port is also set to ''.
  • If the port is et, and not to the default for the scheme, URL.port is set to the port number given.

This PR adapts the original description that was wrong, and adds 2 examples.
items.title: Update URL.port

items.content_html:
Summary

Rephrase the ordering of arguments of comparison to make it easier to understand. Now it reads like:

  • If the result is greater than zero, it means a is greater than b and hence, a comes after b.
  • If the result is less than zero, it means a is less than b and hence, a comes before b.

Motivation

Improve readability.

  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: Rephrase the ordering of arguments of comparison

items.content_html:
Summary

This PR adds content about HIDDevice.forget, SerialPort.forget, USBDevice.forget.

Motivation

BCD already contains data about these interfaces, they either already shipped or are being shipped in Chrome soon, so it makes sense to document them as well.

Supporting details

  • USB: shipped in Chrome 101
    • Testing steps
    • Chrome status
  • SerialPort: will ship in Chrome 103
    • Chrome status
    • Intent to ship
  • HIDDevice: shipped in Chrome 100
    • Chrome status

Related issues

mdn/browser-compat-data#15920
mdn/browser-compat-data#15597

Exceptions, or Options, or Parameters are definition lists in the modern structure.

I found a bunch of them not following this rule, so I fixed.

There are a few minor fixes along the way, too.
